channel.title: Otis Jiry's Scary Stories Told in the Dark: A Horror Anthology Series
channel.description: A multiple story, horror-themed audio storytelling podcast, spun-off from Chilling Tales for Dark Nights and its popular YouTube channel of the same name. The show features master storyteller Otis Jiry, and the work of dozens of independent and previously-published contributing authors. Find this and our other great programs at: https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com. We wanna make the podcast even better, help us learn how we can: https://bit.ly/2EcYbu4 For advertising opportunities please email PodcastPartnerships@Studio71us.com Privacy Policy: https://www.studio71.com/us/terms-and-conditions-use/#Privacy%20Policy

channel.content:encoded:
A multiple story, horror-themed audio storytelling podcast, spun-off from Chilling Tales for Dark Nights and its popular YouTube channel of the same name. The show features master storyteller Otis Jiry, and the work of dozens of independent and previously-published contributing authors. Find this and our other great programs at: https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com.

We wanna make the podcast even better, help us learn how we can: https://bit.ly/2EcYbu4 

For advertising opportunities please email PodcastPartnerships@Studio71us.com   

Privacy Policy: https://www.studio71.com/us/terms-and-conditions-use/#Privacy%20Policy

item.title: S11E21 – "Tricks" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured authors: Nicholas Gray and The Vesper's Bell. Otis presents a series of Halloween tales regarding pumpkin-related incidents, one involving teenagers and an ill-fated trip to cause trouble at a pumpkin patch and another where strange decorations crop up across town with serious consequences.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast
If you like the show, telling a friend about it would be amazing! You can text, email, Tweet, or send this link to a friend: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: S11E20 – "Darkly Paranoid" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Philip K. Dick. Terrorism on Mars takes an interesting turn when nobody can exactly figure out how the perpetrators are avoiding detection in the first story of the show. In the second, a crew's desperation for food leads to a conundrum when the feast starts talking back.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast
If you like the show, telling a friend about it would be amazing! You can text, email, Tweet, or send this link to a friend: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast

item.title: S11E19 – "Seeing Things" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Dale Thompson. In our first story, what originally appears to be a perfect pair of glasses reveals more about a man's neighbors than he wished to know; in the second, a man's normal routine when he discovers that something strange is watching him.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast

item.title: S11E18 – "Won't You Come In?" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Nick Botic. Tonight, Otis features a freakish encounter in a hotel and the bizarre habit of a seemingly normal ride-share passenger.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: S11E17 – "The Stars Are Watching" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Kyle Harrison. A deep sea exploration turns south when an unmanned probe's AI begins acting in mysterious ways, and a lovingly gifted sword from Japan reveals a deadly conspiracy, from earth and beyond.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast

item.title: S11E16 – "Unhappy Returns" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Mark Towse. Luck is out of the picture for two unfortunate souls in tonight's excursions, the first finding himself with a mysterious illness while living with the love of his life in a small village, the second inspired to search for treasure by voices that may or may not be in his imagination.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast

item.title: S11E15 – "What Do You Fear" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Corpse Child. Fear will grip you with a story of an unfaithful man's desperation to win his wife back by any means and another of a cruise ship where a passenger carries a dark tale of a coming horror.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: S11E13 – "Inscrutable Tellings" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Dale Thompson. In the first excursion of the evening, a family is haunted by a strange being...but the ritual needed to stop it proves to be just as obsessive as the evil forces stacked against them. In the second, unheeded advice leads to an encounter with a creature who won't take no for an answer.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast

item.title: S11E11 – "Properly Unsettled" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Micah Edwards. Four shorter tales to taunt your dreams, weaving through strange goings-on at a hometown church, a friend whose almost supernaturally on time for everything, a fog that plays tricks on more than your mind, and a couple whose future happiness is affected by a long held secret.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast

item.title: S11E10 – "Chance Encounters" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Blake Blizzard. Three tales are covered in this week's episode. In the first, a campfire chat is more sinister than would appear at first. In the second, a sleeper awakens to find he is not alone in his room. In the third, a board game at a local store has deadly consequences when played.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast

item.title: S11E09 – "Regretful Acts" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Seth Paul. In tonight's featured first featured story, a discovered manuscript reveals a tale of betrayal and vengeance from beyond. In the second, a trip for some fast food leads to something with much hungrier aspirations.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: S11E02 – "The Trappings of Life" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: P.D. Williams. Otis brings two tales in which appearances can be a little deceiving. In the first, a desire to impress might...or might not...lead to just the right promotion. In the second, it's one thing for a house to get flipped...but what if it doesn't care for the effort?

item.description:
Tonight's featured author: David Niall Wilson. Season 11 opens with two tales of individuals learning of things they should not know. In the first, a tattoo artist finds himself creating a masterpiece for a very strange individual. In the second, two friends peel back the veil separating reality from illusion...only to realize some illusions exist for a reason.

item.title: S10E015 – "Always the Quiet Ones" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Christopher "Slimebeast" Wolf. The evening consists of two devilish delights: first up, what appears at first glance to be an unpleasant, dreary summer working on the farm isn't that at all...it's much, much worse. In the second, a very popular fellow around town mysterious disappearance leads to a ragtag group forming a search party...but finding answers leads to deadly consequences.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: S10E014 – "Get on Your Bad Side" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Kyle Harrison. Three tales of terror grace your ears this evening: first, an honest attempt to create something good for the world takes on a terrible life of its own; second, a fun trip to an amusement park leads to some strange personality changes for a young boy; and third, two programmers succeed in depicting the afterlife beyond their worst possible nightmares.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT
Don’t forget to subscribe to the podcast for free wherever you're listening or by using this link: http://bit.ly/ScaryStoriesPodcast

item.title: S10E013 – "Things Get Worse" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Tonight's featured author: Chisto Healy. Otis presents two stories of situations that can't get any worse...until they do. In the first, a night at the bar brings a surprise visit from an old acquaintance, who won't let the relationship be forgotten. In the second, a walk in the woods to blow off steam instead becomes a harrowing attempt to survive a strange accident.

item.title: S10E012 – "At the Edge of Deceit" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
This week's author: Brandon Faircloth. Otis brings your ears two tales to keep them soundly awake: in the first, what appears to be a cut and dry case of battery turns south when the attackers begin to fare worse than the victim. In the second, a wanderer on the Appalachian Trail hears the story of something strange...something that wants to be friends in the worst way...
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

In the second, a man suffering from severe depressive episodes finds himself transported to a strange realm across the universe.

item.title: S10E005 – "You Have a Kind Face" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Dan Weatherer whips up two tales of freaky outcasts and merciless wordsmiths. In the first, Otis narrates the story of an initiation involving a dark subway, a boogeyman, and several missing persons. In the second, Otis brings to life a hapless author who can't get any attention...until he starts "cleaning" the books of a local literary firm.

item.title: S10E002 – "Wring Out the Old" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
It is a new year, and Season 2 brings two stories of frights, one from author Jasper DeWitt and another from Brian Martinez. In the first, we learn of the secret history of what Saint Nicholas really did...what is in store for years to come. In the second, a young man retells a story of his childhood...about the sister he tries to protect, his abusive father, and something which comes to the window in the night.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: S10E001 – "New Beginnings, New Dimensions" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
In the first episode of Season 10, Otis ends the year with a selection of stories from The Vesper's Bell. In the first, a late night call to an asylum reveals more about the keepers than the patient. In the second, not every alien who abducts humans are gray...and their methods lead to grave bodily concerns.

item.title: S9E024 – "Spiritual Presents" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
'Tis the Season, and for THIS Season 9 finale, Otis brings a bag of Christmas creeps by various authors. In the first, a cracked skull due to a mishap leads to being able to a psychic gift and discoveries about people's darker habits. In the second, an EMT working on Christmas deals with his own inner demons. Following these, as a bonus, Otis takes a short detour into more well-known territory with a reading of "'Twas the Night Before Christmas."
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: S9E023 – "This is All Normal" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Ron Riekki brings four short and shivery stories for Otis to deliver right to your auditory door. An expat doctor finds new life in China, a grandfather protects his family in a very strange manner, a thrillseeker finds himself pulled into the wrong alley, and in a strange future we see what happens to those to whom death no longer holds any sway.

item.title: S9E022 – "Hellish Hubris" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Dan Cardoza brings two thought-provoking tales of characters who find their bad choices lead to devastating consequences. In the first, a man's ill-advised flight to win back his ex-wife leads to a shocking discovery. In the second, theft and murder are only the beginning when a deadbeat father and his long-fostered son connect under the worst of circumstances.

item.title: S9E020 – "Always Watching" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Otis brings you three tales from David Feuling. In the first, a group has gone out into the desert to find themselves, only for something malevolent to find them. In the second, a mother's strange obsession with dolls leads to a horrible revelation only years after the fact. In the third, a boy hears a strange tale from his cousin about a growing collection of dead insects and inhuman nighttime visitors who have taken a dangerous interest in him.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: S9E017 – "Halloween Treat" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Otis narrates a very special episode especially for Halloween, where he receives two cursed artifacts from two different senders (authors Seth Paul and Richard Morgan), both of which have terrifying tales to tell. The first involves a father whose son receives a Halloween fortune that turns out to be much more literal...and awful...than one would assume. In the second, a search for an arsonist reveals a deadly, supernatural plot, along with a very devilish pair of shoes...

item.title: S9E015 – "Dead Ends" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Otis serves up two slices of terror from Ryan Peacock. In the first story, a successful businessman goes to take care of the only thing that could stand in the way of a long and happy retirement...but he may not like the consequences. In the second, an elderly man's attempt to stave off boredom by attaching a camera to his wandering feline leads to a revelation he may have been better off not knowing.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.description:
Otis brings two J.R.T. McMahon tales to life in this chilling edition. The first involves a man who tells a story of his childhood, his abusive father, and his strangely painted ceiling. The second tells of a strange TV which can show what might have happened had events not unfolded as they did in real life.

item.description:
Keith McDuffee provides the chills as Otis reads two tales. The first involves two people on the run from a large, unstoppable force, and the second about two would-be CB radio pranksters who find that the joke is actually on them.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: S9E05 – "The Abandoned" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
Christopher Gideon provides the scares this week in two tales of terror. In the first, an elderly man's routine is interrupted by the arrival of a building in town only he seems to see, while in the second, a test of bravery in an old college building leads to horrific recollections of the past.
To watch the podcast on YouTube: http://bit.ly/ChillingEntertainmentYT

item.title: Introducing: The Town Whispers
item.description:
We’re proud to introduce you to the latest horror series on our network: THE TOWN WHISPERS - a serialized audio drama written, produced and performed by Cole Weavers. In the series, you’ll explore The Fort, a town hidden behind the fog, the trees, and the rain of the Pacific Northwest. A town where the locals manage to sleep easy most nights, despite the screams heard echoing over the nearby bog at night – and something just isn’t right.
The Town Whispers is a horror audio drama that exists at the crossroads between Eldritch terrors, and folk horrors. If you enjoy Lovecraft, The Wicker Man, tales of Pagan lore, or Twin Peaks, you’ll love The Town Whispers!
In this episode, you’ll hear the first thrilling chapter of The Town Whispers in its entirety. While you’re listening, make sure to subscribe on Apple Podcasts or wherever you listen to your favorite programs, so you never miss a new weekly episode – there are over a dozen chapters available now – or click the link below.
Link: https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/the-town-whispers/
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.content:encoded:
We’re proud to introduce you to the latest horror series on our network: THE TOWN WHISPERS - a serialized audio drama written, produced and performed by Cole Weavers. 

In the series, you’ll explore The Fort, a town hidden behind the fog, the trees, and the rain of the Pacific Northwest. A town where the locals manage to sleep easy most nights, despite the screams heard echoing over the nearby bog at night – and something just isn’t right.


The Town Whispers is a horror audio drama that exists at the crossroads between Eldritch terrors, and folk horrors. If you enjoy Lovecraft, The Wicker Man, tales of Pagan lore, or Twin Peaks, you’ll love The Town Whispers!


In this episode, you’ll hear the first thrilling chapter of The Town Whispers in its entirety. While you’re listening, make sure to subscribe on Apple Podcasts or wherever you listen to your favorite programs, so you never miss a new weekly episode – there are over a dozen chapters available now – or click the link below.

 

Link:

https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/the-town-whispers/

item.title: Introducing: The Shadow Diaries
item.description:
Introducing a brand-new horror narrative podcast, The Shadow Diaries. The Shadow Diaries is a genre-bending, 12-part narrative horror story about Shana Secco, a young reporter on her first assignment, going on tour with the world’s biggest pop star, Eliza Gold. To Shana, this is all she could have ever hoped for: getting an inside look at the glitz and glamour of a superstar icon. But it won’t take long before Shana uncovers something strange; something mysterious lurking behind the scenes. Now, it’s up to Shana to face the dark and evil forces at work, but can she save Eliza Gold and her millions of fans from a horrifying, twisted fate? What secrets lie behind the fame of Eliza’s stunning comeback? Who or what are the mysterious forces behind the scenes? Starring Madelaine Petsch (Riverdale) as pop star Eliza Gold, and Kara Hayward (Moonrise Kingdom) as hungry journalist Shana Secco, with Constance Zimmer, Lydia Hearst, and Carter Jenkins. Subscribe here to The Shadow Diaries so you never miss an episode!
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 23: S6E23 – "Age-Old Oddities" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you four spine-chilling tales from authors N.J. O'Neail, Clark Ashton Smith, Theda Kenyon, and Gertrude Macaulay Sutton, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry. This episode's hand-picked collection of stories are pulled from the pages of the September 1930 edition of the iconic American fantasy and horror fiction pulp magazine, Weird Tales – the very same publication that gave writers such as H.P Lovecraft and Clark Ashton Smith their starts, and which inspired generations. item.title: 17: S6E17 – "Where It All Ends" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you four spine-chilling tales from author Matt Dymerski, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry. Matt is an award-winning Ohio-based author of horror and science fiction who has been entertaining readers for over a decade, and was the winner of Reddit NoSleep‘s “Best Multi-Part Story of 2012” for his Asylum series, as well as the forum’s “Best Story of 2017” and “Story of the Month” in January 2018. In tonight’s program, we're confident you’ll see why.

item.title: 16: S6E16 – "Unnatural Narratives" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you four spine-chilling tales from authors August Derleth, James Causey, John J. Wallace, and Alice-Mary Schnirring, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, a hand-picked collection pulled from the pages of the January 1943 edition of the iconic American fantasy and horror fiction pulp magazine, Weird Tales – the very same publication that gave writers such as H.P Lovecraft and Clark Ashton Smith their starts, and which inspired generations.

item.title: 06: S6E06 – "Where the Skies End" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you four terrifying tales from author Christopher Maxim, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, about astral instructions, creepy canines, eerie elevators, and dangerous desires.
Today, we’re asking for your help, if you’re able to offer it, on behalf of tonight’s talented featured author. Regrettably, Chris has been hard-hit both financially and physically by the coronavirus pandemic. He suffers from a high-risk health condition that’s left him immuno-compromised and quarantined indefinitely. Coupled with serious issues collecting unemployment, Chris has found it difficult to make ends meet, let alone afford the treatment he needs to improve his health. So, we'd like to ask you a simple favor: if you’re able to help in any way, whether by donating to him directly, or by purchasing his books on Amazon.com, it would mean a lot to all of us.
We’ve set up an author profile for Chris on our website, at https://www.SimplyScaryPodcast.com/maxim. On that page, you’ll find links to Chris’s Amazon page, as well as an assortment of his featured books. You’ll also find a donation link that will allow you to show your appreciation for his bone-chilling fiction by contributing a few dollars to him directly. Just look for the donation link us his social media links, at the top of the page. You can also use the page to contact Chris, if you’d like to ask about other ways to help. From Chris and everyone on our team, thank you for your support of indie horror and of our talented writers in their time of need.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 22: S5E22 – "Speak and Spell" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you four terrifying tales from authors Benjamin James, Jay Corvus, Luis Bermudez, Sean Tivenan, and Erik Peabody, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, about terrifying testaments, devilish disappearances, selfish saviors, caustic companions, and horrific hosts. Each of this episode’s tales were written by competitors in 2019’s Evil Idol voice acting competition, hosted by our friends at Chilling Tales for Dark Nights. The competition, now in its 3rd round, began in October, and features 50 contestants vying for this year’s championship crown, with 90 stellar performances to enjoy! Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 19: S5E19 – "Strange and Scary Things" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you seven terrifying tales from authors Kevin David Anderson, H.K. Reyes, Nick Botic, William Dalphin, Felix Blackwell, Robert Ahern, and David Feuling, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, about fiendish folklore and so much more! All of the tales in tonight’s episode were originally planned to be included in Chilling Tales for Dark Nights’ trilogy of horror anthologies, produced in homage to the iconic Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark book series. However, a decision was recently made to produce longer stories for those books, meaning that many of the excellent short stories are now able to be made available to you here, on this very program.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.description:

Joy, and SpookFox, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, about extraterrestrial transmissions, alien entertainment, insidious institutions, and imminent extinction – all of them themed around the idea that there’s got to be more than mankind living in this universe of ours, and that not all of that life may be benevolent.

item.title: 10: S5E10 – "Rise and Fall" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description:
In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you two terrifying tales from Shannon Higdon, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, about doomsday from a distance and suicidal assistance. Also, a warning to our more sensitive listeners: tonight’s episode contains content of a particularly violent and emotionally jarring nature, and its stories with particularly sensitive subjects and situations, which some of you may find traumatizing, or which may trigger stress and anxiety. If you are predisposed to panic attacks or suffer from PTSD, please be prepared. Thank you for your understanding.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 6: S5E06 – "Dimming Daylight" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you four terrifying tales from authors Rhoads Brazos, Jason Parent, Patrick Meegan, and Rebecca Fung, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, about dangerous doors, suspicious strangers, damnable dreams, and spiritual sacrifices. All of tonight’s tales are featured in the horror anthology, Daylight Dims: Volume Two (https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/daylightdims2/) , and are featured here with the kind permission of their authors. The sequel to the original Daylight Dims, Volume 2 features thirteen stories that cross the genres of surreal, dark fantasy, and heart-pounding dread – guaranteed to twist your perception of horror. From the common, comfortable tropes, to the more taboo, these handpicked tales have a literary aspect designed to showcase what true horror can be. If you’d like to support the authors and editors behind tonight’s frightening fiction, click here to pick up your copy today (https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/daylightdims2/) , or learn more about the books in the series at DaylightDims.com (https://www.daylightdims.com) . item.title: Bonus Episode # 1 – "Say Your Prayers" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this bonus episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you two terrifying tales from authors Aaron Shotwell and Stephan D. Harris, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, about devilish deals and paranormal protectors. Sign up to our mailing list to be entered to win monthly giveaways and custom stories, plus access to EXCLUSIVE subscriber-only narrations and inside updates: https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/otis/ If you enjoyed “The One You Live With” by Bram Stoker Award-winning publisher, Crystal Lake Publishing, and author Josh Malerman, please consider checking out and purchasing the anthology it’s a part of, entitled: Gutted: Beautiful Horror Stories (https://amzn.to/2RAFQie) — a disturbing journey into the beauty that rests inside the very heart of darkness. The book contains fifteen short horror stories and a poem that span nearly every twisted corner of the horror and dark fiction genres. In it, among other things, you’ll hear about a woman that experiences an emotional reckoning inside a haunted house, a man that awakens a vengeful spirit and learns the terrible price of settling scores, and a father that sees his daughter rescued after a cold case is solved, only to learn the tragic limits of his love… and much, much more! The Gutted anthology features the most celebrated voices in dark fiction, including Clive Barker, Neil Gaiman, and Ramsey Campbell, as well as a number of exciting new talents. So pick up your copy today! See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/bonus-episode-001/ Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 3: S4E03 – "Fright Bites" – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this episode of Scary Stories Told in the Dark, we bring you six terrifying tales from author Micah Edwards, performed by host and narrator Otis Jiry, about ominous omissions, wicked wardrobes, ruinous reflections, and much, much more! All six of this program’s terrifying tales come to us courtesy of indie horror and science fiction author Micah Edwards, whose latest collection of 30 sinister stories, entitled “Fright Bites”, can be found on Amazon.com, along with several of his sci-fi novella. Pick up your copy of the book here: https://amzn.to/30rLdlt Edwards is an accomplished author of stories designed to intrigue and thrill. His tales run the gamut from horror to heroism and beyond. Whether it's a short story making you jump at shadows or a page-turner you can't put down, his stories will keep you on the edge of your seat and ready for more. In addition to his books, his work can be found on the NoSleep subreddit, as well as at https://RetroActivitySerial.wordpress.com. More information – and even more stories – visit him at http://Micah-Edwards.com today. And if you enjoy what you hear tonight, please support Micah by picking up a copy of Fright Bites today, available in Kindle and paperback editions for as little as $2.99. The book contains several of the tales featured tonight, as well as many others you won’t hear anywhere else! See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: https://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s4e03 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 25: Season 2 Announced: A Taste of Terror from Horror Hill – Presented by Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: Good evening… this is Otis Jiry, host of _Scary Stories Told in the Dark_. I hope you’ve enjoyed the first season of the program, and all 24 episodes. Myself and the team at Chilling Entertainment and the Simply Scary Podcasts Network are hard at work on Season 2, which begins right on schedule this upcoming Wednesday, May 16, now with three *free* stories per episode. But, in case you who just can’t wait until next week for your fill of frights, you’re in luck, as I come to you today with the gift that keeps on giving. If you don’t already know, mine is not the only horror audio drama on the Simply Scary network. We also produce the program that started it all, the _Simply Scary Podcast_, which frequently features yours truly, and which just launched its third season this past Tuesday. Season 3, episode 1 features me in a starring role, so don’t miss it. (You can see that episode here: http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/the-simply-scary-podcast/3x01/) If you’re not a subscriber to the _Simply Scary Podcast_, you can find them also on SimplyScaryPodcast.com, as well as on iTunes, Stitcher, Google Play, Spotify, and wherever else podcasts are found. And if you’re just discovering our friends over there, you’ve got a lot of catching up to do, and there are more than 30 episodes for you to satisfy your taste for terror with. Also on the network is our brand new program, _Horror Hill_, starring _Chilling Tales for Dark Nights_ fan-favorite Jason Hill as both host and narrator. Jason’s show is for mature audiences only, is not for those faint of heart, and features a wide range of anthology horror from both published and unpublished authors, complete with sound effects and music. So if you’re interested in losing any more sleep, he’s got your fix every Thursday night. For those of you listening in now and supporting me, I wanted to go the extra mile and make it easy to experience what it’s like over at the Horror Hill… so, with the kind permission of Jason, I present to you the latest episode of his program, in its entirety, here on my feed. If you enjoy what you hear, please subscribe to _Horror Hill_ on iTunes or your podcast app of choice, leave him a 5-star review, and post a kind word if you feel so inclined. It would bring a smile to this old storyteller’s face to see fans of my show enjoy his as well. From all of us here at the Simply Scary Podcasts Network, where we like to give you more horror than you can handle…. stay spooky… and enjoy the show… and I’ll see you next week for the debut of Season 2 of _Scary Stories Told in the Dark_. See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here:http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/horror-hill/s1e14-hh/ Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
item.itunes:title: Season 2 Announced: A Taste of Terror from Horror Hill – Presented by Scary Stories Told in the Dark

item.title: 20: S1E20 – “Unseen Spectres” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this twentieth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from [Aaron Shotwell](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/aaron-shotwell/) and an anonymous author, performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), about the occult nature of the fabric of our collective reality, and the (sometimes unwelcome) entities that exist on its outskirts, just outside of our detection. item.title: 18: S1E18 – “Whispers in the Dark” (Part 2) – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this eighteenth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we pick up where part 3 of author [Eric Dodd](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/eric-dodd/)‘s series “_The Stairs and the Doorway_” left off last week, and continue the saga with the fourth part – and the conclusion – of his thrilling tale, entitled "_The Side Tunnel,"_ again performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/). Join us once more as explore the secrets beneath our feet, in a search for answers, and perhaps closure. See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e18/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e18/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 17: S1E17 – “Whispers in the Dark” (Part 1) – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this seventeenth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you three terrifying tales from author [Eric Dodd](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/eric-dodd/), all of them connected and part of the same series of events, performed here in sequential order by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/). Journey with us in the dismal depths of dormant places, which hold secrets darker than the Stygian pits from whence they come, and discover what happens when mortal man comes face to face with its eternal inhabitants, with no choice but to listen to its "_Whispers in the Dark."_ See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e17/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e17/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 16: S1E16 – “The Patient” (Part 3) – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this sixteenth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you chapters 7-9 - and the thrilling conclusion - of author [Jasper DeWitt](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/jasper-dewitt/)'s epic horror saga, performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which chronicles the events in the life of a practicing psychiatrist and his interactions with the patient that nearly drove him out of medicine. We hope you enjoy the finale of "_The Patient._" See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e16](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e16) Learn more about your ad choices. item.content:encoded:
In this fifteenth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you chapters 4-6 of author [Jasper DeWitt](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/jasper-dewitt/)'s epic 9-part horror saga, performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which chronicles the events in the life of a practicing psychiatrist and his interactions with the patient that nearly drove him out of medicine. Join us again next week for the thrilling conclusion of the story, with a performance of the final 3 chapters of "_The Patient_." See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e15/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e15/)

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 13: S1E13 – “Happily Never After” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this thirteenth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from [J.D. McGregor](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/jd-mcgregor/) and [Robert Ahern](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/robert-ahern/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which explore what might happen when one discovers that there is more to life… and death… than they had always imagined, or been told. Once our protagonists discover the truth, will their own inevitable ends be as fairytales, or will they be doomed to live "_Happily Never After_?" See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e13/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e13/) Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 12: S1E12 – “Best Kept Secrets” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this twelfth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from [K. Banning-Kellum](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/k-banning-kellum/) and [L. Chan](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/l-chan/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), about the darker side that every city has lurking in its clandestine depths, which to this day continue to remain undiscovered thanks to the select few that – whether out of fear or greed – maintain their _"Best Kept Secrets."_ See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e12/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e12/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 11: S1E11 – “Nostalgic Nightmares” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this eleventh episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from [Douglas Greenwood](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/douglas-greenwood/) and [Dylan Charles](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/dylan-charles/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which transport us to two mystery-shrouded towns, where the arrival of prodigal son and an unusual visitor changed everything and left everyone who met them suffering from "_Nostalgic Nightmares."_ See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e11/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e11/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 10: S1E10 – “Breathless” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this tenth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from [Jon Grilz](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/jon-grilz/) and [J.D. McGregor](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/jd-mcgregor), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which explore (and exploit) the all-too-true fear many have of finding themselves trapped in constricted spaces. Before diving in, be sure to take a gulp of air. As you become transported into the confined space of Grilz and McGregor’s minds, you might just find yourself "_Breathless."_ See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e10/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e10/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 9: S1E09 – “Fear of Flying” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this ninth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from [Michael Marks](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/michael-marks/) and [Arthur Conan Doyle](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/arthur-conan-doyle/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which in its protagonists' efforts to explore and exploit newfound heights promises to give new meaning to the phrase “_Fear of Flying_.” See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e09/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e09/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 8: S1E08 – “The Outer Circle” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this eighth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you chapters 4-7 – and the thrilling conclusion – of [William Hope Hodgson](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/william-hope-hodgson/)'s masterpiece “_The Hog_”, performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which makes clear that just outside the periphery of man, there lie those which have desires regarding us which are incredibly more dreadful to our minds when comprehended than an intelligent sheep would consider our desires towards its own carcass. These monstrosities, Hodgson writes, reside within the “_The Outer Circle_.” See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e08/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e08/) Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 7: S1E07 – “Dreadful Eternity” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this seventh episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you the first three terrifying chapters of [William Hope Hodgson](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/william-hope-hodgson/)'s masterpiece “_The Hog_”, performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which will ensure that you never look at wildlife the same way again. For once you’ve seen beyond the veil, there’s no coming back from the “_Dreadful Eternity_.” See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e07/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e07/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 6: S1E06 – “Watchers in the Woods” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this sixth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from [Dustin Koski](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/dustin-koski/) and [Anansi](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/anansi/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), which will provide ample reason to stay as far away from dark forests and campsites for the rest of your lives. If it weren’t for the occasional sound of a twig snapping, after all, you might not even be aware of the “_Watchers in the Woods_.” See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e06/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e06/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 5: S1E05 – “Risk and Reward” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this fifth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from [Ben Pienaar](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/ben-pienaar/) and [Thomas O. Wagner](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/thomas-o-wagner/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), about making what at first appears to be a deceptively simple choice: make a deal, get a reward. But as many often do, our protagonists find out that there are many different interpretations of an agreement to be had. The only remaining two questions are: which end of the bargain will they end up on, the victim’s, or the opportunist’s? And, wherever they find themselves, will it be worth both the “_Risk and Reward_?" See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e05/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e05/) Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

item.title: 4: S1E04 – “Yuletide Terror” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this fourth episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two spine-tingling holiday-themed tales from [Michael Whitehouse](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/michael-whitehouse/) and [Kristopher Mallory](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/kristopher-mallory/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), about both frightful, devious dinners and mysterious Christmas baubles with sinister secrets yet to be revealed. After a listen to these tales, you’ll never look at this time of year the same way again. Brace yourself, not for twinkling trinkets, gifts and decorated trees, but for an unforgettable taste of "_Yuletide Terror."_ See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e04/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e04/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 3: S1E03 – “Singularity” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this third episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from an anonymous author and [Christopher Gideon](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/christopher-gideon/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), about both sides of the A.I. (Artificial Intelligence) coin, and the abject fear that one can experience both being the creation, as well as the creator. Regardless of which end of the spectrum you fall on yourself, or or empathize with, one thing is certain: the "_Singularity"_ will someday affect us all, and when it does, pulling the plug may not be so easy as we expect. See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e03/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e03/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 2: S1E02 – “Caveat Emptor” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this second episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from authors [Christian Thompson](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/christian-thompson/) and [John Morressy](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/john-morressy/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), about shops discovered in both out-of-the-way places, as well as in plain sight, which hold within their walls some treasures that sound just too good to be true. Sometimes, the old addages turn out to be more true than one could ever expect, and the Latin phrase “_Caveat Emptor_” – buyer beware – becomes more crucial than ever. See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e02/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e02/) Learn more about your ad choices. item.title: 1: S1E01 – “Danger in the Dark” – Scary Stories Told in the Dark
item.description: In this debut episode of _[Scary Stories Told in the Dark](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/shows/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/)_, we bring you two terrifying tales from authors [Jeff Hartin](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/jeff-hartin/) and [Polum Chill](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/authors/polum-chill/), performed by host and narrator [Otis Jiry](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/performers/otis-jiry/), about things that go bump in the night, in the dark…. and which react in interesting fashion to light. Sometimes, it turns out, it’s better to see what’s after you. Other times, not so much. After all, you can never be quite what sort of “_Danger in the Dark_” is on your tail. See full episode details, including the text of the featured stories, here: [http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e01/](http://www.simplyscarypodcast.com/series/scary-stories-told-in-the-dark/s1e01/) Learn more about your ad choices.
